behaviour.feedbackOnCorrect: Correct! When code-breakers decode or "decipher" an encrypted message, they reveal the original message, not a translation of the original message. When British mathematicians decoded secret German military messages during World War Two, for example, they were basically unscrambling scrambled German. Once the scrambled messages were unscrambled, they still had to be translated from German into English!
behaviour.feedbackOnWrong: Wrong! When code-breakers decode or "decipher" an encrypted message, they reveal the original message, not a translation of the original message. When British mathematicians decoded secret German military messages during World War Two, for example, they were basically unscrambling scrambled German. Once the scrambled messages were unscrambled, they still had to be translated from German into English!

l10n.a11yCheck: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.
l10n.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
l10n.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.

question: Machine translation is a type of code-breaking.
